posts.cooked: Our team is trying out Swerve for the first time this year however when we tried to create an Auto Routine with PathPlanner instead of following the path the robot just spins out. This is the ideal auto: And this is what ends up happening: BrokenAuto.zip (75.2 KB) The code is hosted here: GitHub - WolverineRobotics/2025CompRobot at swerve-YAGSL

posts.name: Canava
posts.cooked:
Hello, we have the same problem, the robot starts to turn around itself. I use pathfindToPose, but sometimes it starts to turn around itself without control.

code :
Where do you place the pathFindToPose() Method,  Is it in the getAutonomousCommand() method in robot container? Also where do you get the pose from?

posts.name: Canava
posts.cooked: we get NavX disconnected error when there is uncontrolled rotation

posts.name: icemannie
posts.cooked: Number of things you need to do:- Update WPILIB and all vendor dependencies. “absoluteEncoderOffset”: 0, shows in all your module json files. You need to line all 4 wheels straight forward per Flowcharts | YAGSL and enter the absolute encoder values from Elastic or whatever dashboard you are using. Then follow The eight steps | YAGSL You also need to add autoChooser per Getting Started | PathPlanner Docs
